title: Château Troussas 2014  Médoc
description: This wine has too much wood for its own good. By now, this should be softening but it is not. There's not enough room for what could be crisp berry fruit. It might soften, but the bitter wood-aging character suggests not.

title: Cruz Alta 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Stalky white-fruit aromas are bland. This wine feels acidic and tangy, while limited flavors of citrus and stone fruits are tart. Pyrazine notes and citrus-peel flavors lead a wiry finish.

title: Château Calmeyrac 2012  Médoc
description: This tight and mineral-driven wine is still firmly tannic. That core of dryness is likely to remain even while the black-currant fruit matures. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Big Six 2015 Whiskey Bourbon Barrel Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: An assertive wood-smoke aroma and pervasive sweet-oak flavors dominate this full-bodied and heavily spiced wine.

title: California Square 2013 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Red fruit, asphalt, dried herbs, cola concentrate, prune and animal skins show on the nose of this wine that comes in a square-shaped bottle. Caramelized blackberries and caramel show on the syrupy palate.

title: Fabre Montmayou 2015 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: A reedy, raw nose is herbal and minty. This feels balky and highly tannic. Flavors of minty black plum, beet juice and peppercorn conclude in wiry, spicy fashion on a rough and tannic finish.

title: Producta Vignobles 2015 Charmes du  (Médoc)
description: Bright red fruits dominate this easy-drinking wine. It has some funky tannins, rustic perhaps, that intrude into the otherwise easy fruitiness of the wine.

title: Cruz Alta 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Rustic berry aromas are rubbery and smoky. This Cab has a raw, angular palate with sharper than ideal acidity. Saucy, herbal red-berry flavors finish with minty, peppery notes.

title: Argenses 2015 Winemakers Classic Block #18 Torrontés (Mendoza)
description: Tangerine aromas are more suggestive of peel than pulp. This is citrusy on the palate, with a mix of saline and oxidized flavors that include hints of lychee and melon. A slightly stale finish indicates a wine past its prime.

title: Cave Robert & Marcel NV Maurice Bonnamy Brut Rosé Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)
description: This yeasty, nutty wine is showing signs of maturity. It has spice, hints of red fruits and a dry aftertaste. Drink this wine now.

title: Fogline Vineyards 2016 Zephyr's Block Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is simple in a mix of marshmallow and vanilla, its oak speaking loudly and with a whiff of sulfur.

title: Pascual Toso 2016 Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Leathery aromas suggest animal hide; otherwise, this smells of lean plum and berry fruits. This Malbec is simple, with thin berry and plum flavors that are slightly oaky in front of a snappy finish with lingering green notes.

title: Paso Ranches 2015 Bourbon Barrel Aged 3 Months Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This bourbon barrel-aged expression shows stewed red fruits, dried ginger and mace spice on the nose. The palate starts smooth, plush and full but then the extremely powerful acidity is almost painful, leading into a vanilla and white-chocolate finish.

title: Rioja Vega 2016  Rioja
description: Leafy berry aromas are a touch green and herbaceous. Like the nose, this wine feels choppy and raw, with rough tannins. Spicy red-fruit flavors finish with scratchy tannins and dry oak notes.

title: Wapisa 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Río Negro Valley)
description: Tropical fruit, mild citrus and mineral aromas are weak. It seems more like fruit juice than wine, without much structure. Citrus, melon and mango flavors show minimal snap through the finish.

title: Zolo 2017 Unoaked Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: This unoaked Chardonnay, despite being young, already seems a bit old. The color is tan, while it smells and feels kind of soft and wan. Sweet, chunky flavors of tropical fruits are adequate, while bitterness rises up on a flabby finish.
designation: Unoaked Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled

title: Mahana 2016 Carbonique Pinot Noir Upper Moutere Hills Rosé (Nelson)
description: As the name suggests, this is fermented using carbonic fermentation. While it should be applauded for trying something new, the experiment, in this case, doesn't really work. Reductive and stinky at first, this eventually blows off to reveal ripe melon and red fruit notes, with florals and (thanks to the carbonic) a distinctly bubble gum quality. The palate, at 14% alcohol, is on the hot side, with a medium to full body and a heaviness of fruit that lacks brightness and freshness.
designation: Carbonique Pinot Noir Upper Moutere Hills

title: Maryhill 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Tavolo Rosso Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Unusual aromas of ashtray and herb are followed by dried out fruit flavors.

title: Region 1 2016 Malbec (Argentina)
description: Pointy red-berry aromas are minty, reedy and wiry. This lean, snappy Malbec is more than fresh on the palate, while lean, spicy red-plum flavors register as slightly weedy and green. A juicy finish maintains the wine's lean, green style.

title: Reyes 2011 Muscat (California)
description: Smoke, ash, sandstone, candied lemon rinds and a touch of botanicals show on the wild nose of this bottling. The palate is sweet and thick with tropical fruit-salad flavors of pineapple, pear and maraschino cherries.

title: Three of Cups 2014 Le Croyant Petite Sirah (Red Mountain)
description: Not entirely settled aromas of barrel spice, mint and blue fruit are followed by tart fruit flavors that come up quite short. Enjoy this straightforward wine soon.

title: Château Tour de Goupin 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: A fruity, crisp blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Merlot, this is lively, with red-fruit flavors still intact and fresh. Drink now.

title: Eagle Eye 2013 Proprietary Estate AlphaWolf Vineyard Reserve Meritage (Napa Valley)
description: Huge puckering tannins make it hard to decipher the fruit imparted by this blend of 81% Cabernet Sauvignon with 14% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot. Oak, cedar and pencil shavings make it through the hearty ripeness.

title: Familia Schroeder 2016 Alto Limay Pinot Noir Rosé (Patagonia)
description: Dusty aromas are low on fruit and fading. The mouthfeel seems round. Bland, yeasty stone-fruit flavors are basic, with a touch of oxidation showing on the finish.

title: Poema NV Brut Rose Sparkling (Cava)
description: Briny citrus and grapefruit-peel aromas are a bit stalky and pithy. This Trepat rosé feels plump but flat, while burnt, candied flavors are low on fruit. A soda-like finish, with only modest acidity, confirms that this purely for easy enjoyment.

title: Quara 2017 Estate Malbec (Cafayate)
description: Earthy aromas of coffee grounds and berry fruits are fiery and grassy. This Malbec is chunky and blocky in feel, with grabby tannins. Saucy berry flavors are oaky and a bit green, while it tastes largely of resiny oak on the finish.

title: Valdelana 2016 Agnus  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry fruits come with a slathering of oak-based milk chocolate. This wine feels chunky and heavy, while a mix of leafy berry flavors with oxidized raisin notes finishes jammy.

title: Château la Fleur Bellevue 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
description: This wine is lean, with a light texture that brings out juicy black fruit and intense acidity. It misses out on the concentration and richness of the vintage.

title: Callaway 2013 Wild Yeast Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Underripe black plum, wet clay and exotic Indian spices show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit simple and muddy, with flavors of cooked blackberries, pencil shavings, wood spice and baked earth, packing in both tannins and acidity.

title: 2Plank 2015 Piste-Off Red (Amador County)
description: This wine has attention-getting cedar and spice aromas followed by extremely oaky flavors and a quite tannic astringent texture. The woody spice-cabinet element is very strong and nearly overwhelms the mild black-cherry flavors underneath.
